## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}





{{< example csharp >}}

```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Snowflake = Pulumi.Snowflake;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var aad = new Snowflake.ScimIntegration("aad", new Snowflake.ScimIntegrationArgs
        {
            NetworkPolicy = "AAD_NETWORK_POLICY",
            ProvisionerRole = "AAD_PROVISIONER",
            ScimClient = "AZURE",
        });
    }

}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example go >}}

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-snowflake/sdk/go/snowflake"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := snowflake.NewScimIntegration(ctx, "aad", &snowflake.ScimIntegrationArgs{
			NetworkPolicy:   pulumi.String("AAD_NETWORK_POLICY"),
			ProvisionerRole: pulumi.String("AAD_PROVISIONER"),
			ScimClient:      pulumi.String("AZURE"),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```


{{< /example >}}

import pulumi
import pulumi_snowflake as snowflake

aad = snowflake.ScimIntegration("aad",
    network_policy="AAD_NETWORK_POLICY",
    provisioner_role="AAD_PROVISIONER",
    scim_client="AZURE")

## ScimIntegration Resource Properties {#properties}

To learn more about resource properties and how to use them, see [Inputs and Outputs]({{< relref "/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs" >}}) in the Architecture and Concepts docs.

### Inputs

The ScimIntegration resource accepts the following [input]({{< relref "/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs" >}}) properties:



{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="provisionerrole_csharp">
<a href="#provisionerrole_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Provisioner<wbr>Role</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specify the SCIM role in Snowflake that owns any users and roles that are imported from the identity provider into Snowflake using SCIM.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="scimclient_csharp">
<a href="#scimclient_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Scim<wbr>Client</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the client type for the scim integration
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="name_csharp">
<a href="#name_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the name of the SCIM integration. This name follows the rules for Object Identifiers. The name should be unique among security integrations in your account.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="networkpolicy_csharp">
<a href="#networkpolicy_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Network<wbr>Policy</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies an existing network policy active for your account. The network policy restricts the list of user IP addresses when exchanging an authorization code for an access or refresh token and when using a refresh token to obtain a new access token. If this parameter is not set, the network policy for the account (if any) is used instead.
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

        <span class="nx">opts</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nx"><a href="/docs/reference/pkg/python/pulumi/#pulumi.ResourceOptions">Optional[ResourceOptions]</a></span> = None<span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="nx">created_on</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nx">Optional[str]</span> = None<span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="nx">name</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nx">Optional[str]</span> = None<span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="nx">network_policy</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nx">Optional[str]</span> = None<span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="nx">provisioner_role</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nx">Optional[str]</span> = None<span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="nx">scim_client</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nx">Optional[str]</span> = None<span class="p">) -&gt;</span> ScimIntegration</code></pre></div>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language go %}}
<div class="highlight"><pre class="chroma"><code class="language-go" data-lang="go"><span class="k">func </span>GetScimIntegration<span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">ctx</span><span class="p"> *</span><span class="nx"><a href="https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi?tab=doc#Context">Context</a></span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">name</span><span class="p"> </span><span class="nx">string</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">id</span><span class="p"> </span><span class="nx"><a href="https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi?tab=doc#IDInput">IDInput</a></span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">state</span><span class="p"> *</span><span class="nx">ScimIntegrationState</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">opts</span><span class="p"> ...</span><span class="nx"><a href="https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi?tab=doc#ResourceOption">ResourceOption</a></span><span class="p">) (*<span class="nx">ScimIntegration</span>, error)</span></code></pre></div>
{{% /choosable %}}

The following state arguments are supported:


{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_createdon_csharp">
<a href="#state_createdon_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Created<wbr>On</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Date and time when the SCIM integration was created.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_name_csharp">
<a href="#state_name_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the name of the SCIM integration. This name follows the rules for Object Identifiers. The name should be unique among security integrations in your account.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_networkpolicy_csharp">
<a href="#state_networkpolicy_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Network<wbr>Policy</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies an existing network policy active for your account. The network policy restricts the list of user IP addresses when exchanging an authorization code for an access or refresh token and when using a refresh token to obtain a new access token. If this parameter is not set, the network policy for the account (if any) is used instead.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_provisionerrole_csharp">
<a href="#state_provisionerrole_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Provisioner<wbr>Role</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specify the SCIM role in Snowflake that owns any users and roles that are imported from the identity provider into Snowflake using SCIM.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_scimclient_csharp">
<a href="#state_scimclient_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Scim<wbr>Client</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the client type for the scim integration
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}
